text: Bottle at tasting session with friends. Thanks Tide! Herbal, licorice, char, alcohol, vanilla, raisin. Sweet but well balanced. Muddy palate and an appropriate finish.

Bottle thanks to Blue_Zulu! Pours near opaque brown/black with no head. Aroma is caramel, slight booziness, dark fruits, prunes. Taste is smoke, slightly peated nutiness, a hint of cocoa, a hint of raisins, honey syrupiness, some apple tartness. Syrupy mouthfeel.

Bottle from Hair of the Dog. Dark brown color, minimal beige head. Bittersweet taste with raisins, dried fruits, oak, toffee, bread and ripe fruits. Bittersweet taste with oak, raisins, dried fruits, resin, toffee, bread and hops. Exquisite American strong.

Aroma is dense roasted malts, raisins, butterscotch and toffee. Taste is again deep deep rich malts An almost chewy mouthfeel. Fantastic light earthy notes meet the intense malt profile and work on harmony. An almost buttery and soft caramel drizzle greets the finish. Light bitterness but subtle. Appearance is black with a thin brown head that understandibly doesnt last long given the high abv.

Bottle into a snifter showing opaque dark caramel brown with no head despite an aggressive pour. 

The nose shows a strong alcohol background with sweet notes of figs, molasses, caramel, smoke, bourbon, and hints of raisins and light red apple.

The palate is full bodied, oily, and slick with no carbonation. Flavors of brandy, light apple, figs, Belgian yeast, and molasses but completely dry with a light vanilla background. The finish shows a lot of bourbon - vanilla, smokiness, and savory umami notes. Very light alcoholic heat despite the high ABV.

Backlog, bottle shared. Poured darker Brown with Some tanned bubbles. Nose of toasted malts, caramel, bitter chocolate, Dried fruits, prunes, riped apples, oak, bourbon, soaked raisins, light oxidized porto kind of notes. Unique and delicious

I didnt rate this? I had it with Bonney back in the day. Ticked 5/5. Right on. Has a bit of haze. No head. Medium brown. The aroma is a bit soy sauce, hazelnut halva, and rice syrup...its a bit complex aroma and these were the first three I pulled out. That eau de vie comes across strong. On the palate, this is soft, sweet, light dates, prune, some fruity dark sugars. The big thing is that it is refined, and smooth.

At hair of the dog. Sweet cherry chocolate aroma. Sweet cherry caramel malt chocolate flavor. Heavy body. Hard to explain but it is amazing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, shared by bergstaden. A murky dark brown beer with a minimal sized, close to just a rim of bubbles, beige head. The aroma is quite oxidized, boozy and sweetish, with leather, raisin, wood, some chocolate and tobacco, even some apple hints and plums. The flavor is quite sweet, with a decent bitterness, quite a bit of warmth, and roasted malts, some bonfire and raisins, leather and tobacco, hints of dried fruits and a touch of dark sugar. Its full bodied and quite warming on the palate, some carbonation left, but its quite flat, and with an everlasting finish. Wow, this is delicious indeed, hope HotD decides to brew it again. 170311

Bottle 355ml vintage 2013 @ geokkjer
[Courtesy of bergstaden] Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, oxidized, dried fruits, raisin, alcohol, coal, ash, smoke, oak, vanilla, leather, tobacco, red apple and bourbon. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, smoked, dried fruity, oak, bourbon, vanilla and roasted finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, courtesy of bergstaden. Pours dark brown with a tiny beige head. Aroma of malt, leather, smoke, wood, tobacco, ripe apples, caramel and charcoal. Flavor is sweet and malty with some vinous notes, smoke, charcoal,chocolate, mint, wood and caramel. Medium body, soft carbonation.

This is one of those beers that Ive chased for a few years and finally got a couple bottles. Massively disappointed. I guess I should have paid more attention to previous reviews around the total flat carbonation of this beer - there is none. Its super sweet, flat, and smoky. If I wanted that taste profile, I would rather have scotch. Honestly, this would be a drain pour for me, if not for the scarcity and work for me to get it. Too bad, I love other HOTD beers and heavy BA strong ales. The flat carbonation absolutely destroyed my enjoyment of this beer.

From bottle thanks to Daawi! Pours a very ugly sediment filled poop brown with a small off white bubbly head. Aroma has cough syrup, light leathery smoke, bourbon, gun powder, cowboy, tobacco, light booze. Taste is sweet, light roasty, toffee, caramel. Light smokey and bitter finish. Full body and a Lie carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to daawi. Pours muddy greasy brown with a small brown bubbly head. Without a doubt one of the ugliest beers Ive ever seen hahaha. Aromas of peat, smoke, caramel, vanilla, dark chocolate, dust, sweet dark fruits, toffee, apples, tannins. Taste is sweet, caramel, vanilla, gunpowder, smoke, tannins, malt, sweet prunes, dates, raisins, apple liqour. Bit of a letdown honestly.

355ml bottle @ the source. 2010 Vintage
Pours a semi-opaque brown with no head. Nose is molasses, fig, caramel, and hints of sweet bourbon. Flavour is just yummy. It goes down so smoothly, while rich in character. Vanilla, chocolate, tobacco and or leather, some dark fruits as well in the back. Great body!

355ml bottle @ the source. 2013 Vintage
Pours a semi-opaque brown with no head. Nose is plum, wood, light apple, swee bourbon. Flavour is just rich, smooth, and delicious... much like the nose.

Big beer. Strong in your face aroma. I was just staining some bar stools Im making, this smells like the stain. Rather smooth for what it is. Smoke. Brown sugar. Oak, and more oak.  Boozy. Thanks Douglas for this top 50 beer!
Pours deep dark brown with no head. Aroma; Vanilla, apples, oak, plumes, figs, toffee and bourbon. Flavours; Chocolate, vanilla, apples, plumes, toffee, bourbon, molasses and oak.

December 22, 2016. Bottle, vintage 2013. Received in a trade with heyta, thanks! 
Black with a minimal tan head. Aroma is malty and fruity with toffee, vanilla, leather, raisins, plum, bourbon, oak, some sweet baked apple notes, warming alkohol. Taste is sweet, malty and light warming. Medium to full bodied, oily sticky texture, flat. Finish is sweet, smooth bitter and slight warming with caramel, plum, candied orange peel, bourbon and light roast. 
Very nice one.

A: Deep dark brown coloured with a thin offwhite lacing N: Orange, lime, chocolate, vanilla, oak, cedar, coffee, ash, apple T: Vanilla, chocolate, hint of tar, apple, pear O: Wow! Very deep and complex and still smooth. Lovely!

12 oz. bottle. Originally reviewed 4/4/2012. Dark brown murky pour with no head. Not even a stray bubble. Flat as hell. Lots of gross looking sediment at the bottom of the bottle.

The nose is out there. Chocolate, apple, leather that all combines to smell like bourbon-barrel Coca-Cola. Sweet aroma. Boozy, too. Fascinating and very nice.

Tastes of sweet caramel, apple, and again coca-cola. Leathery, but not enough to balance out the sweetness. Licorice. I get a lot of the Eau de Vie, but not a lot of the bourbon barrel in the taste. Very sweet.

Flat as hell. Thick and syrupy. Sweet. Everything that makes it tough to drink.

Its a fascinating beer. I honestly dont know how much I like it. The flavors are amazing, although I dont know how well they go together. Unique enough to really impress me, though.

2007 bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan bubbles. Aromas of toffee, cocoa, smoke, fruitiness, bourbon, brandy and light oak. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth with a dry finiish. Flavors of toffee, cocoa, fruitiness, bourbon, light smoke, light brandy and a hint of oak with a smooth dry lingering fruity toffee finish.

Sample at the brewpub. The beer pours a hazy dark copper-brown color with a medium thin foamy white head that diminishes gradually to a film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit and malt. Full-bodied with flavors of charred malt, dark fruit, oaky bourbon and vanilla. The finish is oaky with a bourbon and malt aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Bottle - huge thanks to Max for sharing this one; shared with Vinny and Paul. Pours a deep brown body with soft lace. Nose is super woody, dark fruits and rich roasty espresso. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with lots of wood dominating the palate - but in a good way; with notes of rich roasted dark fruits, maple, molasses and soft gentle alcohol in the back.

Bottle generously shared by Max at Pauls. He said this one was at least 5 years old. Pours brown color with minimal head and lace. Notes of basement, florals, plum, fig, dirty wood, sticky molasses, and rich stogie. Medium to fuller body. Easy going and luxurious at the percent. I miss hair of the dogs of this quality, had about 15 at Borefts a year ago but they were all shit. This one brought me back to the good old days.

2010 bottle. Aroma is rich dark fruit, apple brandy, cookie dough, mild bourbon, huge vanilla, and light smoke. Tastes like apple brandy and cookie dough mostly. Huge vanilla, some dark fruit, some chocolate, light smoke. Just the slightest oxidation. No carb. Medium body and super slick mouthfeel. Pretty awesome overall. Im betting this is past its peak. Would love to try this again some day a little fresher.

12 oz bottle purchased at the Brewery Tap Room (Portland, OR). Consumed on site, 2010 Vintage. Pours a deeper hazy brownish hue, some purple jabs of dried fruit, tamarind color with a gentle glow on the edges that is subtle. Loose bubbly head dies to a mellow ringer, tannish layer laces smaller but the nature of the beer likely leads to that. Aromas are dried fruit, a bit of raisin and vanilla meet jabs of toast, caramel and faint cocoa. More dark and dried fruit preach plum, black cherries and raisin elements mixing with some decent growing bourbon influence, spirit and vanillin, gentle warmth and subtle apple influenced spirit. A bit deeper, residual brown sugar and gentle caramel malts behind with mellow toast. Initial is medium bodied, a touch of barrel thinning leaves it with a touch of body. Caramel and oak meet dark fruit, subtle yeastiness and some fuzzy tannic oak. Gentle spiciness, dying sweetness and more raisin, gentle tannic and sticky faint molasses appeal, brown malts. A fruit element that melds and expands, dark fruit, gentle apple, some nice oak elements and oxidized and sherry like vinous appeal is firm and flowing. Rich flavors, sufficient expertly manicured oak influence as this one ends up smooth and rich all at the same time. Chocolatey and biscuity, so much going on as the flavors ebb and flow wonderfully. Rich and flavorful, a good mastered blending and aging time as this one ends up light enough without being just oak/spirit dominated. Rich, a bit carmelized, brown malt and molasses mix with toastiness, oak, and gentle fruit, dark fruit and plum. Subtle honey, earth, oak and that gentle apple spirit really adds some complexity on top of that lovely well managed bourbon spirit. Delicious masterfully crafted stuff. World class. While the nose and pour arent necessarily winning awards, the flavors and flow contained within definitely are.

2013 bottle split 3 ways on 3.29.14.

Dark chocolate in color with no head. Smells like dark fruit and a bit earthy.
Flavor is toffee and some chocolate notes. Very oily. Drinkable. I like it!
2010. Deep caramel malty smell and taste. Full body, very low carbonation, and no foam.
2013 bottle at HotD. Dense murky brown pour with no head. Aroma is plum, mild apple, wood, bourbon. Similar taste. Palate is slightly dense with very soft carbonation.

I got to try this, fuck, over a year ago. Maybe a 2-3 oz sample pour from a buddy. I didnt take any notes, but I got to thinking I should just enter it and maybe someday Ill get to try it again and do a proper rating, but I was at work so I didnt have time. I just remember it being very dark brown with basically no head and having a very complex aroma with dark fruit and some smoke notes being predominant. It was very sweet and the body was heavy, oily, and soft to almost not even carbonated. It was a great experience and one I am thankful for being a part of. Someday perhaps I will get to try it again. But until then, Daves not here, man.
Bottle...Pour is dark with a very small head..Nose is Chocolate, rich, plum, alcohol, vanilla, some smoke, musty, dry oak...Taste is maple, apple skin, dark fruits, spice, chewy and rich..
2013. Dark copper, almost black. Nose is booze and prunes. Taste is the same, with a touch of ass. Rough finish.
2013 bottle, Pour is murky brown with low carb. Aroma is big sweet figs, dark fruits, and light barrel. taste is similar, very rich and decadent.
some fruity sugar and tang to it with wood in the background. more than a bit of dankness to this bottle. a little cider and a dash of cocoa. boozy yet beery.
Bottle shared with Doug. Cheers! Burnt caramel, dark fruit, black treacle. Taste is great, quite thick, low carbonation, lots of fruit. Light spice. Golden syrup.
Drank during the tasting 08-05. Awesome beer. Very rich. Awesome sweet taste. Fruit, raisins. Great beer.

12 oz bottle at the Hair of the Dog, Portland, OR. 2013 vintage.
Dark reddish brown colour with no head. Plums, figs, prunes, more dark fruits, sweetness, mild chocolate notes, sweet malt and dessert wine in the aroma. The flavour is... out if this world. Amazing flavour of dark fruits, sweetness, brandy, chocolate, malt and all the goodness in the world. 
So so so tasty! I'm willing to sell my soul now! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

15/III/15 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ ElMananas 1st 9050 tasting - BB: n/a (2015-377) Thanks to ElManana for sharing the bottle!
clear purple brown beer, small to no head. Aroma: sweet, vanilla, bourbon, dried fruits, alcohol, dark chocolate, cocoa powder. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: sourish, sweet, caramel, alcohol, sugary, slightly smoky touch. Aftertaste: little hoppy, caramel alcohol, slightly smoked, hoppy.

Tap at Brouwers. Deep, rich mahogany brown, a small ring of head. Musty, tangy wood aroma, autumn leaf mould, a touch of smoky sweetness, like candied bacon, a tiny bit of sherry-like oxidisation (but not unwelcome). Light-touch of carbonation, just the right amount to lift it. Caramel sweetness bonded to roasted hazelnuts, Germanic schnapps character, some light vanilla, a touch of smoke and a hint of cocoa. Sweetness lifts it as it warms, but body is cut through with a tang of very light tartness. Really good.

A big thanks tectactoe. Dark dark brown look with some small bubbles rising. Dark deep nutty and dark fruit aroma. Great nose. A thin smooth sweet flavor mixed with some apple skins and caramel. A smooth smokey oaky flavor. So many flavors. A very nice sipper. Solid stuff like everything from this brewery.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 Draft pour at Brouwers 10th anniversary. Listed as the 2010. Very dark amber pour, so much flavor in this one sweet aroma, if you ever have a chance to try this one, do it. You won?t regret it!
12oz bottle. Bottlworks X version. Poured a brown color with a small sized head. Caramel, roast, some nuttiness, smoke, bourbon, fruity, and chocolate.

[2/24/15] Bottle at Hair of the Dog in Portland. 2013 bottle. Nice viscous dark brown with a small beige head. Lovely sweet aroma of bourbon, vanilla, raisins, prunes, chocolate, cookies, caramel, nuts, wood and some apple brandy. Sweet flavor with caramel, cookies, vanilla, dried fruits, bourbon, some apple brandy, wood, a bit of chocolate, nougat note and an alcoholic note. Nice rounded mouthfeel. Great.

Bottle at ElManana's 1st 9050 tasting, thanks! Dark brown, almost black with no head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, some alcohol. Very thick mouthfeel, oaky, some roast/smoke present?, vanilla, bourbon, nice.

2013 batch shared by Pruf. I had the original batch a while ago thanks to Timothy. I guess I should finally rate it. Pop the cap and pours like a dead dark tea. Who needs carbonation? Aroma is very strong, alcohol strong, and lots of autolysis. All of that covers up potential smoke or anything positive. Its actually the stuff I hate in big beer. If I sip the beer without breathing its doable. In the flavor I even get a little smoke, charred black malts, its not sweet, Its got lots of tough flavors. The flat body does not help. But its better than the sum of its parts.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text:
Bottleworks X Bottling
From notes. Tasted on 3/16/13 from a capped 12oz bottle that I shared at our epic Bottleworks tasting with Curtis, Jedi, and crews from Knoxville and Nashville. Pours dark cola brown with a thin tan head that leaves very thin lace. The nose is super malty caramel and brown sugar with a nice dose of smoked malt. The flavor is all about the caramel and brown sugar with an added darker date and raisin note, very light smoke adding complexity, and the alcohol held in check nicely. The body is full with light carbonation and a long lightly smoked and very malty finish.

Bottle from a trade. 2013. Dark brown pour. No head. Aroma of chocolate, tobacco, smoke, dark fruits. Taste is sweet with a slight booziness. Complex. Medium thick mouthfeel. Low carb. Loved this one.
Bottle shared thanks to artmcd8. Poured clear brown with light beige head. Aroma is super caramel light roast malts sweet. Light carb med bod. Complex taste quite sweet boozy tobacco roast.

Bottle as a present. 2013 Vintage. Brown pour without head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, and apples. A nice richness to this. Boozy with hints of apple, brown sugar, caramel, chocolate, and charcoal. Really nice.

2013 from bottle to glass. Dark hue with creamy brown head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, chocolate, tobacco, vanilla, oak, hickory smoke. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a full body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet with a huge savory following and slight ethanol finish. Overall, this brew is amazing!

2013 bottle in trade with bursprak, Thanks mate! Muddy brown pour into Unibroue glass. Minor head. Aroma is oak, mild bourbon, molasses, prunes, dates. Great complex smell which doesnt rely on any one characteristic. Also, one of the very few beers with a dark fruit smell which doesnt remind me of a Belgian strong, which is good. Taste begins with massrive sweetness like fortified wine, then honeyed prunes and dates, toffee, caramel. Lovely soft carbonation. Abv extremely well hidden. Finishes with a very very mild smoke which is surprising for its lightness - must have used less smoked malts in this most recent vintage. Dry finish. Just a great drinking beer here! As it warms dark fruits take over more and a boozey vibe. Overall, best HoD Ive yet had - perfect balance between sweet and savoury. Like the best parts of Adam and Fred had a baby and called it Matt.

Bottle [from trade with cavemanlawyer, big thanks!!] @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus and Niels. Opaque dark brown to black color, small off-white head that diminishes instantly. Aroma is malts, alcohol, honey, sweetish, sugary. Tastes about the same: malts, alcohol, honey, sweetish, sugary, perhaps a slight bitter. But its just not, no totally not what I had expected it to be. Quite a disappointment.

Bottle @ benzai. Dark brown colour with no head. Smells sherry, bourbon, sweet, alcohol, red wine, rinse appelstroop, boozy. Pretty sweet stuff. Tastes cider, cork, mead, honey, alcohol, sweet, booze, wallnut. Full body, soft carbo.
Bottle, thanks GT2, black pour, tan head, nose is caramel, taste is caramel, boozy, sweet, awesome.

355 ml bottle split two ways, thanks Aaron! Almost black pour, slightly see through at the edges, with a small beige head. This one has so many things going on, tobacco, vanilla, apples, loads of dark dried fruits, roast, some light smoke and some bourbon. In a weird way all this comes together in a beautiful way and its a great sipper.

Bottle at Hair of the Dog. Pours black with very little to no head. Aroma is strong of chocolate, sweet, molasses, coconut, apples, roast . Taste is a little roasty, sweet fruits, low carbonation, full bodied, tons of flavor. Overall, great.
Strong ale he fuckin tells me. Brewed with candy sugar and a bunch of fucking tutus. Who is this Matt jerkweed?

Bottle from HotD, 2013 vintage. Pours a near black color with no head on there at all. Nose has barley and very slight wood elements, slight caramel and chocolate, and a bit of dry wine. Taste is thick and complex, rich, with a bit of licorice and dark fruit. Feels super smooth and drinks wonderfully.

(12oz bottle) cloudy dark brown, fine and soapy tan bubbles. Nose of Apple, brown sugar, caramel, light peat, candi sugar. Taste of caramel, bourbon, sweet, rich, marshmallow, thick body. Long linger.

Bottle @ HotD, 2010 vintage, enjoyed three years after bottling. Is it in any way possible to fulfil the expectations following this bottle? Well, it starts very good, pouring velvety black with a nice finger thick creamy and mocha head. Aroma definitely follows in style with magnificent roasted malts with dark fruits and prunes, as well as an oaky wooden sweetness with a nice vanilla bourbon touch. Full and powerful, yet without overdoing anything. Full creamy body with soft carbonation, nicely following the velvety theme. Flavour is sweet with burned malts, muscovado, tobacco, vanilla and oak barrels, as well as cocoa and chocolate. The balanced sweet after taste finishes up all the expectations and then some.

Brown black colour, white head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla, a hint of apples. Sweet flavour, wood, bourbon, chocolate and caramel. Sweet finish, vanilla, apple, sticky dates and wood. Forgot the vintage, but a great brew it is!!
(From 355mL bottle @ Antwerp Gettogether Tasting. Shared by digita7693, LoPo87 and Sam. Thanks guys!!)

Bottle: 2010 vintage. Thanks, Jeff. Thick, viscous looking pour; a mix of dark brown & black in color with essentially no head. A modest, thin tan ring around the edge is the only sign of life. Insane aroma; honestly one of the best in business. Dizzyingly complex. Black cherries, figs, oak, vanilla beans, bourbon, semi-tart apples, caramelized brown sugar, toffee, blackcurrants & plums, ashy tobacco, light char, smoke, & a beautiful residual sweetness that ropes everything together & never comes off as overpowered or cloying. The alcohol commands itself on the palate, but asserts robustness rather than messiness, as the integration is nearly seamless. Sweet apples drenched in bourbon with a huge melange of fruit coming off; cherry, grape, plum, sugar coated dates, & currants, all coated in a thick lacquer of sticky toffee, caramel, molasses, brown sugar, & sherry. Lots of wood & spicy, wet oak in the periphery with a finish that veers more towards the signature Hair of the Dog flavors of ashy tobacco leaves, earthy leather, & mild smoked cedar. Huge beer on the palate, thick enough to cut with a knife; viscous, oily, coating. Boozy oak, dark fruits, apples, molasses, & roasty campfire smoke are leftovers on the palate, & will be lingering for days. Absolutely incredible.

Bottle. Thanks t0rin0! Murky deep brown liquid with minimal light tan head. Aroma of raw sugar, dark fruit, port wine, tobacco, peppery spice, toffee and sweet alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, toffee and raisins. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Really good, complex. Awesome sweetness.

Bottle 13 - Pours a dark brown w/ light tan head. The nose is bourbon, smoke, sweetness, and smoky. The taste is chocolate, apples, sweet, dates, and bourbon. There is some booze here but still drinkable and pretty smooth. Its kind of an odd beer but it seems to work well.

(old rating, 04/2012). (almost) black beer, dark beige, fast disappearing head. Roasted malts, sweet alchol, bourbon and porto, vanilla en red fruit in the aroma. Taste: chocolate and licorice, sweet soft alcohol, bourbon, dark red fruit and resins, vanilla, ... Very good indeed!

Holy apple brandy spicy smoky goodness Batman! Possibly my favorite new Portland beer from the 2014 trip. A little boozy, otherwise faultless. Loved the toasty sweet and smoky aspect. A real treat. Glad we sprung for a 2013 bottle at HOTd.

Bottle from Chris. (I think, it was a while ago). 2013 edition. Dark murky brown. Not much carbonation. Smell is a bit of booze and sweetness. Taste has a scotch peat smokiness, caramel and brown sugar, some apple notes, maybe even apple brandy like, boozy, but no heat. This is defiantly a unique beer, somewhere in the old ale barleywine realm. Not sure what barrels used but like insaid it gives off a scotch and brandy taste.

Pour is extremely dark brown, murky, tan head. Nose has olive, chocolate malt, some peat and a light smokiness to it. Hints of caramel and brown sugar with a tough of dates. Taste is much more smokey and peaty, almost scotch esq. meaty an salty in the flavor, hints of the rich chocolate malt. Some sweeter berry malt in back. Maybe some iodine in there. Body is full with soft carb and creamy feel.

Dark brown poured from a 2013 12 oz bottle. Minimal head or I just dont know how to pour properly. Beautiful malt and caramel aromas. Pleasant smoky taste that is well hidden in the aroma. Just realized this is 11.5% and it feels like its less than brandy Fred. Leaves a good sweet after taste. It is quite thick to the pour. Feels a little heavy, I could definitely have this for sipping. Slightly sweet for my highest rating.
Poured from 12 fl oz bottle. Dark brown with no head. Caramel, chocolate, raisin, molasses, syrup on the aroma. Same taste plus a lot of smoke. Alcohol is well hidden.
Bottle sample at Muckfest V on 7/12/14. Clear brown pour with no head. Aroma of booze, caramel and chocolate syrup. Malty and caramelly flavor with a boozy finish.
Matt jleer and bigjoos are week putrid smell and a tiny unsatisfied flav with no kick from mimi and hubby

Bottle at Hair of the Dog. Pour is deep brown, almost Merlot like with a small tan head that quickly dissipated. Huge oaky, grapey, tannic, caramelized sugars, figs, sweet fruits and bourbon notes in the aroma. Taste is highly complex - smoke, licorice, dark grapes, leather, tannins, prunes, and wood leading to light heat on the finish. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Very interesting beer and another winner from Hair of the Dog that cant be defined by style.
At Hair of the Dog with Taylor, Stephen, Dina, and Rob. Pours dark dark brown, with no head. Aroma is sweet fig, sticky molasis, raison. Typical awesome hotd barleywine, nice.

2013 bottle at the brewery. Pours a dark brown with low carb. Nice barrel notes with some bourbon and big apple brandy nose. Taste is strong apple brandy sweetness with slight cinnamon on the end. Exceptional overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle at HotD.

No head.
Body is black.

Aroma is heavily malty (caramel, chocolate, roasted grain), with notes of alcohol, brown sugar, cognac, raisin, wood.

Flavor is heavily to harshly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Full body, syrupy texture, soft/flat carbonation, heavily alcoholic.

Smells fairly nice, but its mostly sugary notes that warn you of its sweetness. And holy balls is it sweet...undrinkably so. I tried, god did I try at 18 frickin dollars for a 12oz bottle. But I could not do it. My teeth/gums ached at every sip. So syrupy, fatiguing, and cloying, ugh. I could perhaps put up with the strong throat burn if it was just anywhere close to being balanced, but as it is, the blazing alcohol just adds insult to injury. Over 80% of the bottle went down the tap drain, Im sad to say. This was once a great brewery.

Bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87.
#1500 rating.
APPEARANCE: black beer, little to no head.
NOSE: alcohol, Bourbon, sweet, chocolate, little coffee.
TASTE: sweet, very balanced, little spiced, little flat, chocolate, boozy, alcohol, wood.

Bottle @ RBWG, Asheville. Thanks to whoever brought this along! Deep brown pour with a small head. Nose is quite subtle. Cherry fruit leather and coffee cake. Pain au chocolate and toasted nut. Rich and sweet. Distinct pillowy marshmallow and roasted chocolate flavor. Further accents of forest fruits. Mild smoked ham. Shag tobacco. Syrupy, oily. Thought-provoking stuff.

355ml bottle @ Hair of the Dog, Portland, OR
2013 vintage - 
Pours dark brown with a tiny head. Aroma is massively complex with loads of ripe fruits, raisins, malts, toffee, caramel, fudge, wood and vanilla. Taste is massive, heavy and sweet with lots of malts, raisins, ripe fruits, bourbon, wood, oak, vanilla, toffee and brandy. Finish is sweet, heavy and malty with nice brandy and bourbon woody notes, apples, vanilla, oak and toffee. Wow, this is quite awesome. An extremely slow sipper.

12 oz bottle. Served at Hair of the Dog, Portland, OR. Pours a still dark brown. Aroma is complex: sweet fruit, spicy pepper, wood, and booze. Flavor is massive: sweet dark fruits, bourbon, oak, vanilla, and a slight spicy character. Low carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Delicious. From notes 2/15/13.

2009 Bottleworks X bottle. Pours a dark copper amber with no head. The aroma is strong smoke, oak, booze, pepper. Thin mouthfeel with flavors that just keep coming as you drink with nice apple coming through in the finish. Wow really enjoyed this one. 

2010-way more smoke then the 09.

Very dark ruby-tinged brown with minimal beige lacing. Complex aroma of overripe apple, brown sugar, dried dark fruits, leather, tobacco, charred oak, and traces of cacao powder. Very good balance of liqueur sweetness with the bourbon bitterness. Smooth, full-bodied by not too heavy, and little by way of carbonation. Mild to moderate alcohol in the lingering finish .
Special thanks to my friend Matt for tasting this awesome beer.And my beer mates Alberto and Vlada.It was epic.Great color, cheery aroma.Perfect!

Bottle share. Original Batch. About as close as you can get to perfection. I can smell this beer for an hour alone. A perfect combination of base beer and barrel aging. Basically is similar to Adam from the Wood but add the eau de vie barrels for that little bit extra that sends over the top. The bourbon and apple barrel mix pefectly to create a sweet bourbon flavor. One of my all time favorite beers.

Thank you luttonm for sharing this excellence. Tested in Belgrade during an amazing private event. Too good to think about rating it right away and now it is too late to list the tons of notes and sensations this beer offers to the luckiest man who holds it. Pours very dark, some reddish appearance and practically no foam. Nose of cherries, jam of fresh European fruit, sweetness. Mouth of an amazing complexity...unique! I will never forget this beer! I will fight to have another one. luttonm THANK YOU!

A- Pours a dark brown hue with little to no head.

S- Prune, chocolate, caramel, hints of sour cherry.

T- Hints of anise up front, sweet brown sugar notes, lots of raisin and prune, sour cherries fade to a faint coffee finish.

M- Thick with medium-low carbonation.

D- An intensely interesting beer that leads to a deeply visceral experience. At first I wasnt quite sure the flavors meshed well for me but after sifting through layer after layer and enjoying it as it warms I have to say its up there with some of the most interesting beers I have had the chance to taste.
Bottle from the brewpub. Very complex with dark rich barley wine flavors and finished off with smooth bourbon. Tasty.

12 oz. bottle. 2013 vintage. Looks dark brown without any head. Thick, syrupy sticky dark malts. Hints of bourbon.
Flavor is almost like a barley wine. Flavor is dark fruits, plums and figs, dark burnt molasses, sticky fruits and oak. Texture is on the sticky sweet side. Sweet and oaky. Nice light slap of bourbon in the finish. 
Overall this is a damn fine sipper. I enjoy the bourbon underneath all dark sweet malts. Complex flavors.

Grabbed this at BottleWorks for $20 a bottle. 2013 vintage

A - Pours a brown to black, sort of hazy and chocolate colored. No head formed at all. Amber edges.

S - Loads of raisin and currants, Super woody, maple and birch with a touch of cedar. Vanilla and roasted milk chocolate

T - Lots of ABV to this one. You get a lot of toffee, wine tannings, grapey persimmon, kiwi, chocolate cake and pudding. Peated as all get-up

M - This coats the tongue like no other beer. Very oily and thick

O - This can definitely use a lot of age but its an incredible brew. try it if you can.

Thanks Sam! Pours super dark brown with a small light brown head. The smell is caramel, booze, dark rich fruit, brown sugar. Taste is super rich, caramel, molasses, brown sugar, dark rich fruit ending with a little alcohol tingling. Full bodied with mild carbonation. A landmark beer.
Intensiv malziger, sehr süßer Antrunk. Klebrig, intensiv schokoladig, etwas rauchig. Sehr süß bleibend, zum Ende auch etwas alkoholisch. Gut! 11/11/8/8//8

Bottle share in 2013. Pour is dark brown with a minimal tan head. Aroma is chewy sweet grain, smoked barley, dark fruits, and mild booze. Flavor has a bit more fruit - apples, chocolate covered raisins, prune, bourbon, and burnt wood. Finish has some lingering peat and ash qualities. Very good.

I loved this beer. You can taste the layers of complexity in this and the effort and love this was made with. Thank you GT2 did this rare gem. A real treat for me. Pours a muddled brown. No head. Aromas are beautiful. Chocolate, apples, campfire. It all sounds strange... But it works. Flavors are sweet and appley at first.. notes of smoke and a touch of booze and oak at the end. Loved this beer.

Thanks cards04 for this one. Very much like a soft barley wine to me. Chocolate and dried fruit with a touch of nuttiness and wood, oak, dried fruit. Unfiltered dark brown with virtually no head. Kind of thin but smooth palate. Sweet and tasty. Nice beer. Very glad I got the chance to try it.

12 ounce bottle from a trade poured in a snifter. Pour is dark opaque brown with zero head. The liquid is viscous enough to cling nicely to the sides of my glass though. The nose features quite a bit of smoke. In the background I can pick out some oak, tobacco, and a bit of the apple brandy. The flavor is pretty complex, and I can easily say that Ive never tasted anything quite like it. You get plenty of smoke, smooth oaky vanilla, and wonderful apple brandy. The mouthfeel is full and viscus

Bottle shared @ Deans aged pale lager tasting, courtesy of kermis. Pours a clear dark brown beer with a small off white head which quickly disappears. Aroma is massive alcohol, massive wood, vanilla and sugary. Some bourbon, oaky notes are present, but Im not sure if Im right about that. Flavor is very sweet, barbecue, smoke, leather, tobacco. Did not expect that at all. There is a slight hint of apples when swallowed. Very complex, layered beer. Long, cloying sweet finish. Great stuff!

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Bottle @ tasting, thanks Chris! Aroma is big chocolate, vanilla, roast, coffee, tar, syrup. Flavour is big chocolate roasty wood, some fruity notes, coffee, liquorice, Great beer, but I like some of the other HOTD beers better than this, so dont know if its "top 50 material". Lovely beer still though.

Bottle at tasting. Creamy brown pour. Aroma is spicy bourbon, chocolate, roasted, tobacco, vanilla and oak. Flavor is massively sweet, creamy and quite woody. Although a little too sweet, it is very smooth and not alcoholic at all for such a high abv. Great brew.

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of big caramel, overripe dark fruit, raisins, tobacco, booze, toffee and massive wood. Flavor is heavy sweet, almost cloyingly so and over moderate bitterness hidden behind. Light apple coming out in the finish along with long wood. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
alcohol aroma. Clear black pour. Awesome brew.
Bottle 2010. Pitch dark pour with minimal head. Raisin, chocolate, licorice, nuts, barley wine, grape, caramel. Sweet, heavy and creamy body. Sweety bitter finish. Awesome
good beer, tasty from the top Down, solid head but finished a little gritty. happy to try

Bottle received in trade nicks6217. Pours very dark brown with a very small bubbly goldenish beige head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with toasted malts, caramel, smoke, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred US oak, caramelized apples, roasted almonds, hay, bourbon, raisins, dates, bourbon, apple brandy, hazelnuts and hints of bitter chocolate. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, caramel, toffee, biscuits, smoke, vanilla fudge, roasted malts, brown sugar, apple brandy, bourbon, charred US oak, roasted coconut, raisins, prunes, dates, moist soil, dried pine needles, wet stone and hints of tummy warming alcohol. Mouthfeel is oily, round, tiny sticky sweet, tiny roasted astringent and full bodied. Finish is sweet and malty with roasted malts, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, bourbon, apple skins, moist soil, biscuits, apple brandy, hay, smoke and charred wood. Incredibly complex

Bottle, huge thanks to Alex (_angst_). Almost black beer, small head. Bourbon aroma, whisky, cream, vanilla, licorice, grapes, raisins, figs, dades, caramel, candy notes, warming alcohol, hazelnuts, nutcreme, toffee, chocolate, vinous notes. Malty caramel flavor, hazelnuts, citrus, raisins, figs, warming alcohol, licorice, salty, tar, cocoa, hay notes. Sweetish alcohol finish with caramel, licorice, grapes and salty notes.

2014 RBWG Grand Tasting.
Dark brown pour with tan head.
Complex aroma. Brown sugar, a touch of smoke, bourbon, chocolate, cherries.
The flavor follows the aroma.
Smooth, very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2015 Bottle pour at the brewery.  2010 vintage. Heavy wood and cherry aroma with some bourbon.  Really nice aged flavor with hints of cherry, apple and oak.  Definitely one of the better, more unique beers Ive had.  Gotta try a newer version if I can.  Very fun beer.  Very well done.
beige head disappears without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma candysugar, umami, soy, porto, sweet, vanilla. taste like aroma, cherries? with sweet aftertaste. dense mouthfeel, fair carbonation.

Hair of the dog matt at RBWG-2014
Intimidating strong aroma suggests boozy syrup over dark bread with a touch of smoke.
Flavor follows. It is sweet and syrupy.

Interesting for sure, but too extreme. More cordial than ale.

Pours a deep mahogany. Light carbonation. Quickly diminishing head, light spotty lacing. Aroma is fantastic. Nice deep oak with sweet molasses and slight alcohol/bourbon sting. A second (and third) smell gives some vanilla and dark fruits. Taste is almost as it smells. The body is relatively light as I was expecting something thicker from the sweet molasses on the nose. The oak, vanilla and alcohol interplay in smooth cohesion. Nothing to overbearing but all very present. Finishes very clean. No alcohol sting, but rather a nice warming sensation. A bit sticky on the palate at the end...some lingering notes of booze and caramel in the back. Outstanding beer.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #51. Bottle shared at the Friday Night Downtown Inn Bottle Share. Pours a hazy dark brown color with a thin tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of earth, toffee, herbal hops, mild smoke. The taste is sweet toffee malts, citrus, raisin, caramel, nuts. Medium bodied, good balance.

Aroma: Bourbon, Smoked Malts, Plums, Candied Sugar

Appearance: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Mild Light, Minimal Brown Head Ring, No Lacing

Taste: Dark Fruit, Bourbon, Brown Sugar, Mildly Smokey

Mouthfeel: Poor Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Boozy, Mildly Sweet

This brew is a fitting choice for my 500th rate. Pours a dark brown. Scent is rich, sweet, and boozy. Flavor is all over the place yet is somehow unified. Smoke, molasses, and fruit combine in lovely fashion. Thick and lasting on the tongue. Bottle - Share from jrob21

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2014 Big aroma wafting across the table. Big smokey flavors. Big everything with this one. Chicory and soy sauce and roasty smoky flavors. Chewy grain. Lots and lots of stuff going on here. As it warms the smoke chills a little bit and some more wood comes out. Plum prune light in the background. Drink this one as the last one of the day because it is a palate wrecker. Upping my numbers a bit after lusting after this beer overnight. The complexity and richness is just unmatched.

Bottle generously shared at the RBWG grand tasting. Hell yeah this is good. Complex, rich flavor of pipe smoke, luscious chocolate, strawberry, and apple skins. Lingering smokiness and luscious luscious chocolate. Masterpiece!
Bottle pour dark brown. Nose mild booze, sweet malt, Slight smoke. Taste more of the roast in the early palate, then sweet malt, heart layer in palate

12 ounce 2013 bottle. Thanks Dan! Pours a hazy dark reddish brown with almost no head. Aroma of fruit, chocolate, malt, and bourbon. Taste is apples, raisins, chocolate, malt, bourbon, and burnt wood. Every sip is a new taste experience. Delicious. Wish I had more to age.
Brown pour with tan head. Aroma is brown sugar. Sweet malt with a nice brown sugar flavor. Medium body with good carbonation.
Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Pours a deep dark brown color, thick. Big boozy barrel caramel toffee dark fruits and yumm. Thick sticky toffee barrel vanilla booze and yumm, more yumm.

I can see why people like this a lot. Very pronounced bourbon character, with some apple sweetness notes, but thats pretty much it. Like drinking some kind of candy coated bourbon apple, I can detect hints of the usual HotD flavors lurking in the beer but theyre all overshadowed by booze.

12oz bottle shared with Doug at the brewery 
Clear dark mahogany with a small beige head and good lacing. aroma of barrel, woody and leather. flavors of bourbon, woody, vanilla and sweet molasses 
Very nice, tasty. Glad I finally got to try this.

Hello Matt, you mowhawk wearing dog. Bottle sent to me from Chris in Seattle - thanks! This is quite nice - thick brown pour with no head and very little carbonation. Maybe just a slight red hue to it. Nose is boozy and sweet, with a touch of smoke. Mouth feel is quite thick and syrupy. Caramel and toffee are huge here, as are fruit and chocolate notes. I get less smoke in the taste than in the nose - maybe a touch in the finish. Really wonderful.

Bottle to tulip
Vinous, bourbon, vanilla, chipotle, but a little boozy.
Brownish red, but no head.
Vanilla, creme brûlée, sweet malt and oatmeal.

2010 bottle. Black oil pour. Aroma - smoke, Sweet bourbon, and booze. Taste -thick mouthfeel, booze, oak, slight bitterness, sweet finish with bits of oak, plumbs and oak. Still hot, but very sugary with a ton of barrel treatment, medium carbonation, sticky finish...YEA!

Bottle, courtesy GT2. Thanks! Pour is inky brown/black with a virtually non-existent tan head. Big legs. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, light smoke, coconut, apple. Taste is chocolate, moderate smoke, vanilla, toffee. Palate is rich, coating, soft, sweet finish.

Shared bottle with Timfoolery. Fantastic beer. Got the hints of chocolate with a the apple notes. This was a 2013 vintage. Probably would have even been more amazing aged for a few years. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle in a snifter. Pours very dark brown with a small, beige head. Aroma of chocolate and smoky malts, some sweetness, oak, vanilla, bourbon and brandy, apple, other fruits, and light yeast notes. Flavor the same with an incredible blend. Smooth texture. A great beer.

Bottle 2010 shared with and huge thanks to my buddy Dennis. Pours deep murky brown with not much of a head. Huge aroma of bourbon, smoke, vanilla, wood, caramel, alcohol and some apples. Very complex and very good. Quite boozey. Complex taste aswell. Pretty sweet and thick. Lovely chocolate finish. Very glad I could try this one.

Bottle 12oz at Hair of the Dog, Portland. Year 2013 made. Colour is deep dark brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, hints of raisins, chocolate, malts, some sweetness and something divine. Fabulous beer.

Bottle thanks to nate321, thanks!! Pours a really dark brown topped by a small rim that offer some lacing. Aroma is of a nice spirit, a nice blend of pommeau and bourbon. You can feel the tartness through the nose. Boozey in an inspiring way. Taste is sweet and lightly roasted, full of warming booze. A slight acidic edge from the apple brandy. Light smoke. Body is full, mouthfeel almost thick. A really, really nice sipper!

Explosive bottle conditioning. Be careful. Dark brown/ black color. Smells sweet, chocolate, prunes, oak, bourbon. Tastes very much of chocolate and booze, sweet prune like aftertaste. Unbelievable beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle, 2013 version, served in a tulip, @ HotD. Pours super dark brown with a reddish tint and very thin light mocha head. Aroma is chocolate, brandy, leather, coffee, charred caramel, and a bit of smoke. Taste is dark roasty malt with a big thick syrupy flavor but oddly a relatively thin body. Dark chocolate, espresso, and dark caramel flavors dominate. Light brandy and restrained smoky flavor on the finish. Feels a bit odd to come down to PDX to grab a beer made for these guys from Seattle, but this is what you do for Hair of the Dog...very impressive beer.

12oz bottle to teku. Im not sure if I liked this beer or not. I would take a sip, set it down, make lots of faces, look at my glass out of the corner of my eye like it was out to get me, and then go back for more. I really got the apple brandy and smoke. Nearly absent carbonation. Syrupy. The darkest brown can be without being black. Lots of booze and dark raisiny fruits in the nose. The big obnoxious tastes were unsettling to my pallet. This is the first beer that I have been afraid of. Very glad to have been able to try it.
Awesome beer, like smoked brandy with a nice bit of malt, its pretty fucking awesome.

Pour of the 2013 Matt at Hair of the Dog anniversary party. Dark brown with no head. Aroma is raisins, dates, honey, prunes, hints of wood and booze. Full bodied, syrupy mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a cloying finish. Taste is raisins, maple, brown sugar, dates, fig, hint of anise, wood. Yum.

Bottle big thanks to deeblo. It pours deep ruby-brown with a small beige head. The nose is earthy, wood, vanilla, toasted coconut, cocoa, dried fruits and toffee. The taste is smooth, toast, vanilla, coconut, plum, fig, raisin, currants, vinous, candy, minimal alcohol, wood, earth, caramel, light smoke and charred wood with a smooth, warming finish. Full body and soft carbonation. Great depth a brilliant balance. Hides alcohol very well-indeed. A great beer all-round.

Bottle cheers to Bruce. You legend! Easily the best beer of the night. Pours dark brown with a small, firm khaki head leaving tremendous lacing. Nose has everything from sweet to bitter. Enticing vanilla and toffee followed by heavy pine driven hops. Then comes the burnt wood and mild chocolate while the dark fruits start to take over - date, fig, currants. Vanilla bean shines the whole time. Taste starts out with sweet vanilla, mild chocolate and woody undertones. Liquorice begins to comes through with sticky creme caramel. The piney hops start to shine towards the finish with brandy like notes and more stewed fruits. Brown sugar plays a role. No booze at all. Unbelievable stuff

Bottle shared at Bruces in London - huge thanks to the Boss. Pours clear brown with almost no head. Rich dark, ripe fruit aroma, tons of figs and dates, supple wood, light earth, hints of cocoa. Big sweet flavor with syrupy ripe fruits, hints of smoked meat, caramel, dates, stewed apples, wood. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Chewy. Warming finish with unbelievable depth, intense dark, dried fruits, raisins, figs, dates, subtle smoke, cake, hints of torched wood. Absolutely delicious. Even a small sip yields an insane amount of flavor. Superb.

Yellow! Something special for rating #2000 - a bottle of Matt from 2010! Thanks to TheBeerSommelier for serviing this up to me! Pours cloudy deep brown with a touch of red. Very little head, although a ring of tan foam does pop up eventually and leave some lacing on the glass. Aroma is definitely "from the wood." There is something very distinctive about HOTDs barrel aged beers. Very rich aroma, dark fruits, lots of dark sugars, molasses, burned caramel, a bit of smoke, perhaps cherry, bourbon of course, oak, chocolate. Flavor is basically heaven - a bit smoky, oaky, bourbon, lots and lots of dark fruity and sugary notes. Quite sweet, with some woody astringence and not much bitterness. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Some heat evident, but considering that it is 12.5% I would say it drinks pretty well. Yep, this beer deserves its status. Awesome.

Ok, so Im weak and couldnt resist opening this bad boy... But hey, could you? 
Pour is murky very dark brown with some red nuances and an almost non-existing head. The head that is, is a few light tan bubbles around the edges of my glass. 
Oh boy, is this delicious and complex, with really much going on. Light smoke, plenty of leather, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, bourbon soaked dark fruits, slight green apples, apple-pie with a burnt crust, burnt sugar, slight banana. UHH, really a lot, and its all rounded up beautifully by the light apple-smokiness in the end (With a little booze added). Oh boy how I dig this.
The taste is rather sweet up-front, with a somewhat harsh bitterness to it. This has a loooong and really well balanced aftertaste of applesmoke and 
burnt sugar.
Medium n oily body, with a sticky texture and a really flat carbonation. I really do enjoy this beer, and could have my nose camping in the glass for hours, cause this smells amazing. 
- A huge thanks to Matt for giving me this 2010-bottle. - Thanks man!!
Bottle - Vintage 2010 - Chocolate, bourbon, soy and oak. Mahogany with no head. So well balanced with oak, bourbon and booze. Brilliant.

2010: Matt har røyktonene til Adam, men er lagret på Kentucky Bourbon og Apple Eau de Vie fat fra Clear Creek. Resultatet er en sjokoladesuffle, med subtile røyktoner, bourbontoner og en hel masse eplesmak. Tobakk og brandy preger ettersmaken.

August 15, 2013 - 2010 bottle purchased at the brewery. Dark brown pour with some head. Aroma was bourbon, chocolate, sugar and smoke. Taste was consistent with aroma. The sweetness is a bit stronger than the chocolate, the smoke sits in the background the whole way and a nice bourbon finish. Very smooth, medium to full body and nice oily mouthfeel.

2010 vintage bottle at Hair of the Dog. Clear black with no head. Lovely aroma of bourbon and chocolate. Taste is perfect: vanilla, sweet goodness, marshmallow. Thick and creamy. Terrific terrific stuff.
Black with little tan head. Brandy and tobacco notes, amazing aroma. Oily body, sweet leathery flavor. So good.
Holy cow. In draft for the first time ever. Pours thick and viscous. Minimal head. Vinous with a ton of fruit esters, sweet cherries. Slight alcohol warming. Truly a masterpiece.
2010 bottle at the brewery. Opaque brown with pretty much zero cap. Aroma of maple syrup, apple, spices, caramel, coffee, raisin. Taste is spicy, raisin, licorice, brandy. Truly a great brew.

Bottle 12 oz. [Bottleworks]
Pours dark brown with almost no head (beige). Minimal lacing. Aroma is of malt, alcohol, wine, caramel, fruits, apples. Taste is of malt, alcohol, wine, caramel, fruits, apples, madeira, berries, roasted malt. Palate: Full bodied. Oily. Overall: Very good, complex. A nice sipper. Doesnt seem affected too much by aging, set appart some interesting madeira notes. Very striking aroma.

Bottle shared by Tommy, thanks a lot! Pour is dark brown with minimal beige head and little to no lacing. Aroma of caramel, toffee, lots of apple brandy, oak. Taste is full of the apple brady character, some toffee, caramel, little coconut, dried fruits, like Tommy said, its sweet and boozy but not cloying. Full body and minimal carb. Very good. Its holding up very well. A true sipper,

Bottle (12 oz). Bottleworks edition. Thanks Daniel for this one! Dark mahogany color with a thin beige head and little lacing. Aroma is incredibly complex with ton of toffee, apple brandy, fruits (name it, they are all there), chocolate, booze, smoke and wood. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately to heavily boozy (but not cloying) with a strong apple brandy presence at first followed by an explosion of fruits and toffee along with chocolate and smoke. Warming alcohol. Full bodied. Low carbonation, but not flat. One of the most complex beer Ive tried so far. No sign of oxidation in this one, it really held up well. Great sipper (even on an hot summer afternoon)!

2010 bottle at HofD tasting room. Aroma is largely bourbon, but also chocolate, apple and bing cherries. Flavor beats the aroma, and I am wowed how good this is. Palate suffers a bit of low carbination, but its full, smooth and clean otherwise. Cheers to my wife and daughter for allowing me to stay, even though they closed the kitchen. Thanks babe. (Luckily, they have cheesecake, even though it wasn't that great.) This beer was absolutely stunning! Ryan, hook me up on the next dock sale buddy!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 bottle shared with friends at HOTD.  Damn.  Pours deep cola brown, almost no head. Aroma of brandy, apple, caramel, smoke, leather, chocolate, vanilla, sexiness, tobacco.   So so good. Taste follows -- so much complexity.  Sweet but somehow not even close to cloying.  Happiness converted into a beer and then condensed into a beer-liqueur.  Thick, viscous, silky slick texture. Soft carbonation.  Fantastic.

Bottle at 16 Tons Taphouse, part of WBBF. Had Matt three times now, and this may be as good as it gets for me. Pours very dark, little to no head. Aroma is huge, apples, brandy, white fruit and smoke. Body retains a nice liveliness. Finish comes in with booziness and fruit as well as brandy again, then moves to a smoky bitterness,  then sweetness again. Massive, and not to be missed.

Bottle shared by an RBer after DLD 2013, 2010 vintage. Really dark brown color. Pretty much no head, no lace. Good hazy color, though. Baked apple, good spice aroma. Nice wood. Some brown sugar. Big body. Dry texture. Light, smooth carbonation. Spicy taste, light sweet. Mild alcohol. Nice vanilla, pretty rich, but not too big or sticky. Awesome, big stuff.
Bottle at Craft Heads, Tokyo. Black colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, raisin. Flavour of dark fruit, raisin. Thick bodied.

12oz bottle at Hair Of The Dog. 2010 Vintage. This is my second tasting of this amazing brew. It's in my top 3. Amazing flavor of raisins and pepper. Omg, there's just nothing else that tastes anything like this.

Bottle. Poured into a DFH tulip style glass.Served at about 55 degrees. Unsure of vintage but probably from the latest one. Pours a dark coffee like brown color with a slight light tan head. Very little carbonation. Dark fruit notes like cherry, woody, slight smoke, and chocolate. Medium mouthfeel. Very smooth. Dark chocolate, bourbon, dark fruit flavors followed by a slight alcohol warming effect. Overall, pretty tasty.

split at a blind tasting with 77 ships. ( blind to him since this was my bottle) 
looks very dark, no foam. smell is a hint of bourbon. dry, sweet ( bourbon) yet no overkill at the BA -taste. very low carbo, wich is good. alcohol is very high in the taste . also get chocolat. aftertaste is boozy

THX! for sharing this one Kraddel. 355 ml. bottle. 2010 Vintage. Pours blackish / very, very dark mahogany brown with light Bordeaux hues & no head. Yep, its as expected flat. Nose carries sweet bourbon, sticky molasses, syrupy dark fruits, clean good quality spirit riding on top of the bourbon barrel, I still find Eau de Vie barrels  even apple ones apparently  weird barrels to use since they basically just add spirit to the whole (albeit good quality), lots of sweetness in the nose of this one, sweet scared barrels & wood vanilla, dark sugar, clean spirit as mentioned riding on top of the bourbon. Taste is sweet dark apples, thick caramel, very thick syrup, thick molasses, creamy barrel & bourbon notes, white wood, lots of sweetness, syrup dark fruits, clean spirit riding at the end, this feels quite boozy & strongly alcoholic, +20 % ABV not 12.5 % ABV, wood vanilla, black chocolate, charred barrels, very warming, the alcohol warms you up in the back. Basically no carb, interesting how this would be with some light carb & slick, full which makes the carb. not all too missed. Fine stuff from Alan.
2010. Bourbon, leather, burnt malts, slightly smoked, a kiss of sweetness on the back end. Slightly sweeter than the Bottleworks X version. Complexity in spades; damn this is good.

Bottle at home, gifted with many thanks to Frank, 18/01/13.
Extremely dark mahogony brown almost black out of the light with no head.
Nose carries a big bourbon hit, plummy, raisens, wood tones, dark candied sugars, booze, fruit cake, toffee apple, lots going on and coming together well.
Taste comprises dark malt, toffee apple, booze, bourbon, wood, candied sugars, shades of Calvados.
Full bodied, smooth - great on the palate, fine carbonation, boozey finish.
Complex stuff, well balance, ticks all of the boxes for me !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: JUL 28, 2013 12oz bottle purchased long ago in 2010. Reviewed from notes, consumed 12-17. 2010 vintage.

A: Black like charred ash. A thin creme lacing and sticky, sticky legs.

N: Deep inhalations of smoke and apple brandy. Chocolate and leather drift in and out between the charred oak. Theres deep vanilla here and caramel. Rich and inviting. 

T: Smoke, candi sugar, and malt. Bourbon and oak notes overlap with the apple brandy depth. A second layer of chocolate and leather. This is absolutely superb. 

M: A hefty body with a completely shocking lack of alcohol. This is carbonated, if barely. Lingers. 

O: A complete tour de force. The 2010 is the superior vintage, by far, in my estimation, and this is drinking quite well at 2 years old. Glad I have more. 

Edit: After having this one on tap for the 2013 vintage, I have come to the conclusion that this is my favorite beer right now and deserves a bump accordingly.

Pours brownish black with no head. Aroma of chocolate, toffee and alcohol. Taste is chocolate, caramel, coffee and tobacco. So chewy and dessert like. So complex

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating # 2500! Bottle from a trade with 5000. 2010 vintage. Pours very dark brown color with no head. Aromas of dark fruits, molasses, bourbon, brandy and a hint of alcohol. Roasted and lightly smoked malt flavors with molasses, chocolate and dark fruits. The bourbon is definitely more dominant than the brandy, but both are evident.  Thick, syrupy body with no carbonation. Even with no carbonation this is a very enjoyable sipper. Huge thanks Andre.

2010 bottle, 12/2/2012. Pours dark brown, light tan head dies away, thin ring of lacing, light hazy slick of foam. Aroma is caramel fudge, smoky roasted malts, dark fruits,apple liqueur,  vanilla and oak, sweet bourbon. Taste is chocolate toffee and brown candi sugar, apple, smokey vanilla bourbon. Full, creamy palate. Very complex, one of my all-time favorites.

Crazy crazy stuff.    I dont think Id have naturally warmed to this beer - its all over the place, wood, heat, fruit, warmth, even smoke.   It risked being nutz and muddy - but hell noes.   Shared with friends, in SF.

A - Pours a dark brown color with a hint of ruby and only a small ring of bubbles. The head fades very quickly leaving behind very little lace.

S - Aroma is a mix of sweet caramel and smoked malts with dark fruit, candi sugar, vanilla, oak, Bourbon, apples, and some booze.

T - Starts off with toffee malts, candi sugars, and some dark fruits with some vanilla and apple. Through the middle, the oak and bourbon come through with some good smokiness and a touch of almost molasses. The finish is a mix of candi sugars, dark fruit, smoke, oak, vanilla Bourbon, apple, and a bit of booze.

M - Full bodied with mild carbonation. Feels smooth with a smokey, sweet, and warming finish.

D - Very drinkable. Really nicely balanced with lots of complex flavors coming together. The smoked malts are a nice touch.
Bottle. Black pour with a smudge of tan lacing. Aroma has smoke, chocolate, bourbon, and apple tones. Flavor is front smoke heavy, but doesnt have the texture, lighter chocolate and malty tones.

Rating #1000 my namesake beer.  Aroma is brown sugar, mollases, leather, dark fruits, bourbon, light smoke, and candy sugar.  Taste is complex robust earthy and medium sweet with a nice dryish finish.  Great stuff by one of my favorite breweries.
This is up with ridiculous beers. So many flavors its insane. Chocolate, candy, smoky, coffee, tons more

Bottle shared at the September 2012 Santa Cruz tasting. Pours deep brown with no head. Sweet spicy bourbon aroma, prunes, raisins, wine grapes. Brown sugar flavor with some campfire smokiness, mild soy, dark fruits. Sweet and strong and delicious.

Enjoyed on vacation in Portland at HOD. I had not tasted many great beers before this, but I knew there was something different and special about it. The beer looked beautiful in the glass with a dark brown color and the head clung to the side. The taste was smooth and balanced with fruit and caramelized sugar and bourbon. Memorable and delicious!
Bottle from Beau. This was the 09. Pours flat bummer. Dark brown molasses brown sugar aroma. Taste is oxidized but not overly. Has some coco and molases

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 355 ml bottle, 2010 vintage @ Hair of the Dog, Portland.
Pours deep dark red-brown color with minimal to no head. Aroma has very strong plum, raisins, sugar, caramel, toffee and port wine notes. Flavour of caramel, ripe fruits, sweet sugary alcohol and cognag notes. Sweet but still exquisite.
5437

35,5 cl bottle vintage 2010 @ the brewpub
Aroma is sweet with dark fruits, plums and american hops. Also hints of cherries. Flavour is sweet and rather strong on plums, sweet malt and sugar - feels a bit like porto. Malty palate with a feeling of alcohol. Complex, contains many features typical to American Strong Ales. The sweetness disturbs me but I guess it is inevitable with a beer like this.
120712. From the bottle at the brewery, 2010 batch. Pours dark brown with a minimal head. Aroma plums, barley. Sweet. Medium low carbonation. Not Bad.

Served with Adam, Adam from the Wood, Cherry Adam from the Wood, Fred, Bourbon Fred, Doggie Claws 05.

The beer appears nearly still and a dark brown color. The aroma is nice, with a lot of booze, pepper, spice, fruit, barrels. Smooth on the palate. UPDATED: APR 7, 2014 12oz bottle, second batch Im told. Big black, minimal bubbles. Very smooth, low carbonation, big pear and oak note. Big, rich, balanced flavors. Grand, pear alcohol. Well hidden alc. Tasty and interesting.

Re-rate (April 5, 2014): I decided to bring my original Batch #1 (2006 I believe) bottle to Belgrade for our tasting. One that Trevor211 so graciously squirreled away for me when it came out. What a difference the time makes, carbonation drops away even more and the leather, smoke, deep red fruit are all dominating the low end, but there are still plenty of sweet apple-pear crisp notes rising above. Gorgeously complex, very deep, unlike any other beer Ive been fortunate to try. Lovely.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2013 3rd March 2010Cloudy dark brown beer, no real head. Light semi dry palate with low carbonation. Spicy apple, sweet aniseed and boozy malt. Finishes with a fair bit of alcohol heat. Already a year old but this likely needs more time. Still a fairly unique beer! 3.55th November 2013Tasting at Bruces pad. Thanks to the man himself for this gem. Almost opaque dark brown beer with a small pale tan head. Palate is smooth and a little dry. Rich malts. Sweetish dark toffee. Tangy fruits. Port wine and a touch of wood. Whisper of vanilla. Brown sugars and a light brandy. Smooth finish. Comes together very well. Delicious!

Pours black with no head. Very little carbonation. Smell is pretty big bourbon and vanilla, some toffee . Some fruity notes like a barleywine. Taste is very sweet, very complex, very little alcohol. Chocolate front, fruity middle, alcohol burn in the back, along with sugar, toffee, caramel and vanilla. Amazingly drinkable for the abv. Great, great beer.

Bottle from BuckeyeBoy, shared by KyotoLefty. Big thanks to both. What a complex aroma! Port wine, prunes, raisins, and .... Looks kinds ugly, prune juice. Verrry sweet, smoky, and sherry-like flavors. Some phenolic notes and wood, too. Myriad flavor changes through initial, mid, and final. It goes on and on. Completely flat, smooth, warming in the mouth. This is a heady brew. So rich and complex.

Bottle, a gift from BuckeyeBoy. Thanks, Jeremy! Almost black, with some orange, flat. Fruity nose, caramel, apple, light smoke, and some barrel. Fruity apple flavor, chocolate, smoke. Very fruity, port, champagne, wood. Amazingly complex, all kinds of flavors going on, yet holds together greatly. Wonderful stuff.

Bottle through recent trade. Pour has a very dark brown color bordering on black with basically no head and a somewhat still look in the glass. Aroma has rich malt, light roast, some complementing oxidation, brown sugar, brandy, and some barrel wood. Wow, a truly wondurful aroma with light fruited touches and such depth. Mouth feel is thick and oily and there is a slight bit of carbonation but not much. Flavor has plenty of malt, a bit more roast/smoke, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, dark fruit, vanilla, barrels, and light bourbon. This is really complex and rich with a bit of heat at times warming you through the glass.

Bottle to oversized snifter (thanks, waltersrj).  2010 vintage.  Looks decent; black with no CO2 or lacing to speak of.  Smells great; malty and bourbony.  Tastes great too; much like it smells.  Nice on the palate.  This is incredible beer!

12oz bottle at the brewery - 2010 vintage.
Deep mahagony brew with very little head.  Aroma is crazy awesome - apples, oak, smoke, bourbon, vanilla, and caramel.  Some sweetness in the flavor with lots of wood, bourbon, and a bit of fruit.  Chocolate and caramel finish.  Wow!

Bottle: Thanks to VsXsV: Vintage 2010:
No head, a dark to blackish light ruby brown colored beer.
The smell is absolutely amazing: butter, vanilla, bourbon, dark fruits, liquor alcohol, ice cream, caramel, toffee, red wine.
If I could give the smell an 11... Definitely!
Taste is another piece of art: soft, gentle, smooth and balanced mix of buttery barley malt, seduced hops, tasty bitter, toffee, oak and light vanilla, barleys sweets, dark buttery fruits, spices, light alcohol, delicious.
After the taste it starts to gently burn in your mouth with a spicy touch than goes into a nice aftertaste of dark fruits like raisin, toffee, vanilla and sticky barley malts
Low to no carbo, soft light vicous velvet mouthfeel, full body and a sticky texture.
This is almost divine! Good grace...
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 12oz bottle at HotD. Pours a deep, dark brown color with a thin with head. Aroma is fruity, apple, vanilla, oak, just a hint of booze. Thick on the palate with soft, creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bourbon, oak, vanilla, sugar, apple, a touch of alcohol, with a sweet, malty, apple finish. Absolutely fantastic.

12oz bottle shared with the local guys thanks to 5000.  Pours a dark ruby brown with a small tan head.  The aroma has smoke, port, caramel, cherry, plums, apple, vanilla, wood, and honey.  The flavor has apple, wood, port, cherry, smoke, caramel, toffee with a wonderful finish of ash, and chocolate.  There is very little carbonation with a full body.  The alcohol is noticeable at times, but does not take away from the experience.  This is a real treat!

I was not too sure what to expect from this, but I was overjoyed to experience it. Fantastic notes of raisin, honey, some black currant, with Vanilla and a lingering bit of Maple that comes out in the finish along with some oakiness. A great deal of complex flavors in this that keep the beer beyond interesting.  This may be a new favorite. Very unique and well balanced.

Was hooked up with this bottle by the very generous doodler so that I could drink it on the 243 day after my birthday.  Dark brown color with a small khaki head.  Pretty murky.  Chocolate, burnt brown sugar, caramel, dark fruits like raisins, and brandy.  Fucking amazing!  Taste is sweet with caramel, brown sugar, raisins, chocolate towards the finish, and some brandy.  Wow!  Utterly amazing.  Sweeter, but man is this great.  Light carbonation gives this a richer character than it already has.  Decadent.  Amazing!

Huge thanks to Søren for this unexpected surprise! Pours dark brown with no head. On the nose you really get the apples, a decent amount of smoke, dried fruits, prunes, jam, burnt caramel, cinnamon, vanilla, dark cherries, chocolate, baked apples, wood and coconut. Very unique aroma! Taste is salty, get the apples from the aroma, late smoke, cinnamon, weak alcohol, soy, caramel, vanilla, very winey, wood and dark grapes which gives it a weak sour touch. Pretty flat on the palate. This beer is very unique and it really does have balance despite the crazyness.

Officially my 1100th rating !! , HUGE thanks to Derek and Matthew :) 
2010 bottle 
Head: Espresso, Small, Away fast 
Smell: Old port, Vanilla , Chocolat, Bit of booze, Some malts, Subtle hint of coffee, Very very rich !! 
Taste: Start is quite boozy with notes of Bourbon, red wine/port, malts, bit off coffee, some sweet apples, candy sugar, then comes a sort of Saké / Kiew like alcohol/fruity flavour in the mouth especially some sweetness , end is oily , then mouth dries because of the second alcohol booze, and all of a sudden a bit of smoke hits thru, it all ends with a deep rich earthy and Old port like herby taste , WOW Alan this one really really surprises me ! so good !

Bottle thanks Søren. Pours deep brown no head, Aroma: Smokey notes, malty, bonfire, dusty, vanilla, apples, green apples, baked apples, oaky,marmelade, jam, fruity notes, ashtray, caramel, farty, decomposing leaves, cabbage, brussels sprouts, a hint of chocolate, cinnamon bark, boozy notes, bourbon notes, Taste: Quite low carbonation, vanilla, malty, some bitterness, apples, grassy, smokey notes, chalky, dry, chocolate, resin, grapefruit, grain, smoth baked apples, toffee, molasses, caramel. this i so unique an a bit all over the place, but comes together beautifully after all. what a trip!

From notes.  First reviewed 8/19/2011.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip.

No carbonation in this beer means there is no head sitting on top of a dark brown beer with a cherry tint.

Lots of apple brandy in the nose, which by itself provides a lot of complexity. Some brown sugar and caramel malt join in the background.

The taste is composed of caramel malt with some brown sugar up front, some figs, raisins, and a touch of sweet cherries next, then a good dash of apple brandy. A bit of alcohol bite, a touch of what I can best describe as spruce, and some general spiciness close out the flavor. It has a relatively clean finish.

The complete lack of carbonation reduces my enjoyment of the beer and is fairly noticeable throughout each sip. Other than that, it has a full body, some stickiness, and some slight alcohol burn in the back of the throat.

Proper carbonation would make this better and really send it into a different category. As is, the flavor is pretty good, but it just does not have all the pieces.

Shared by daknole. Bottle pours deep mahogany with pretty much no head. Aroma is caramel, toasted marshmallow, oak, dried fruit, milk chocolate, and smoke. Flavor shows the same with additional notes of apple, overripe peach, burnt brown sugar, and bourbon. Overall body is full and the finish shows some warming alc.

RBAG 2012. THANK YOU JEFF!!!Ruby brown pour with no cap. So much going on in this aroma......It be epic! Vanilla, brown sugar, limited soya sauce, hints of sweet purple grape, and I swear Im smelling celery but that seems more the wrong.  Taste is so phenomenal I just came.  Cinnamon, cherry/maybe grape, tons of wood, mild smoke, more vanilla. The bourbon aging is perfect. Caramel malts turning slightly chocolaty, beer starting to get sweet. WOW what a great beer it held up to its hype and I probably would found many more flavors if not for the limited quantity I had.

RBAG 2012. Had this one relatively sober and thankful for that. Pours dark brown with no head, but instead some moderate tan lacing. Aroma is of wood, malt, grass, dark fruit, and smoke. Taste is very boozy. Beneath the booze is wood, malt, dark fruit, vanilla, smoke, grass, and even a little chocolate. Mouthfeel is very thick and sticky. Finish is very hot, almost peppery. I didnt get many wine characteristics out of this, but instead got lots of booze soaked wood and preserve flavors. Very well balanced, even with everything going on in this brew. A real pleasure to try this brew.

RBAG! - Bottle, with MASSIVE thanks to Vertical Bacon Strips! Pours hazy toffee brown, thin pale tan head, no real lacing to speak of. Nose is soya sauce, tar, leather, sausage, toffee, smoke, tobacco. Fuck but this smells amazing! Flavours of toffee, smoke, caramel, marmalade, tobacco. A rare beer genuinely worth the hype! Great stuff!

RBAG. From 330ml brown bottle. Black pour thin ring of tan foam. Nose has brown sugar, booze, tangy. Smokey taste, tangy, brown sugary malts. Finishes sweet, lots of bourbon. Complex, but very drinkable.

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours black with no real head. Smells of cherry, vanilla, smoke, wood, toffee, apple and brown sugar. All at the same exact time, intense. Tastes peaty and smokey, with a strong sweetness and very smooth toffee feel. Fantastic but compared to the Deliverance I just drank it could use refinement (but thats tough to live up to).

Bottle at HOTD.  $18.  Pours to a super dark brown body with no head.  The aroma is amazing.  Like a really aged Adam with sweet calvados and vanilla laden oaky bourbon.  The flavor is where this beer is perfect.  Rich chocolate syrup like with delicious calvados and vanilla and oak laden bourbon.  Masterfully blended.  It is hard to describe how complex this is.  The palate is rich and not alcoholic at all.  Rich and creamy and full bodied.  Not sugary sticky but has a residual sweetness.  My girlfriend is angry at me because Im introducing her to so many good beers she doesnt want to drink the "swill" any more.

After several failed attempts at landing this beer I finally found someone that would throw me one. Thanks. Shared with others, this beer is still.


Served with Adam, Adam from the Wood, Cherry Adam from the Wood, Fred, Bourbon Fred, Doggie Claws 05.

Beer is completely flat, brown, sweet aroma, dark, legs on the glass which is a Stone IRS glass for those keeping score.

Aroma is malt, bourbon, apples, sweet, oak.

Beer is medium in body, really sweet, strong, very dry, a little too dry for me, but the more I drink the more I like it. Strong, sweet, nice liquor backbone, leading up to a bitterness-less finish that leave the mouth dry. I would have liked a less dry finish but ultimately this was good.

Serving type: bottle

2010 bottle at HOTD - viscous dark amber, nearly black - thick ass beer - nose of vanilla, fig, raisin, plum, bourbon, damp oak, smoke - thick, slick mouthfeel - spicy alcohol and oak up front - notes of raisin, fig, treacle, leather, smoke, cherry, chocolate, overripe apple - spicy finish, with long-lingering smoke and warming alcohol - simply fucking awesome - thanks for convincing me to try it, Mike.

Courtesy of 5000 via trade
Bottle:  The aroma consists of coconut, chocolate, maple syrup, light apple, and alcohol.  It pours a dark brown with no transparency and an almost nonexistent beige head...really just a few sporadic bubbles around the edges of the glass.  The flavor starts with chocolate, caramel, and vanilla. There are some apple notes in the background.  The finish has notes if coconut, light maple syrup, and faint bourbon.  Full bodied with miminal carbonation and a somewhat syrupy mouthfeel.  Overall, an outstanding barrel aged beer and incredibly smooth considering the ABV.

Courtesy of Pailhead. Dark brown, oily, no head. Malt bomb, vanilla, bourbon, syrup, light ash. Bourbon dominates the flavor, hints of vanilla, syrup, hot alcohol. As it warms, alcohol comes through more and more, really detracts for me. Flimsy on the palate, no carbonation whatsoever. Decent overall.

Bottle courtesy of pailhead. Pours a opaque brown with virtually no head. Aroma is vanilla, smoky, oak, chocolate. Body is full.Flavor is chocolaty, coffee, vanilla, smoky, oak, with a smooth finish. My rating doesnt do justice. Absolutely wonderful!

Bottle (2010). Thanks to phredrik for sharing. Dark brown with a thin head. Lovely aroma dominated by chocolate, freshly baked bread, apples and with a hint of vanilla, alcohol and liqourice, Incredibly well balanced! At first it is quite sweet, but a slightly bitter finish, which prevents it from being cloying. The flavour is quite fruity, especially apples is dominant but cherries and plums are a part of the flavour profile. Combined with the chocolate characterm the well hidden alcohol and subtle smokey notes, the fruity flavour makes this ale extra ordinary good!

Bottle thanks to Ben, thanks! Pours a dark brown with a strong ruby hue and a gray head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of chocolate backed by dark grains, light fruits, smoke and a bit of astringent alcohol. Flavor has a nice combination of chocolate and smokiness with backing light fruit.

Bottle 33 cl from pantanap. Pours brownish black with a small ring of tanned small bubbles around the glass, looks very thick and oily. Aroma is fullbodied and fantastic. Dark fruits, very sweet and vinous in front followed by good maltyness, vanilla, coconut and alcohol. Mouthfeel is deep and fullbodied, oily and thick. Flavor has a nice twist of alcohol in it, very sweet, vinous, spicy, vanilla, madeira, raisins, fidges , fruity and nicely bitter. Finishes fruity sweet and bitter with a good warming alcohol touch towards the end.

Well well well.. finally opening one of these after buying it last November at the 10AM release at the brewery for the 2010 version - thanks to those Portland dudes who dumped me off at Brass Horse after - Beardface and leems - a double thanks for not simply raping me and dumping me in an alley on the way. Poured out a beer - a beer with colour and a bunch of stuff on top of the beer. Mostly very dark with a reverse horizon of deep crimson redness on the bottom of my glass.
